title: Installing Docker in Ubuntu 20.10 (Groovy Gorilla)

content: Ubuntu ‚ù§Ô∏è Docker Hello everyone, Recently I installed the latest non LTS version of Ubuntu 20.10 Groovy Gorilla, and found it a bit of a hassle to install Docker with this, following the repository tutorial step.
title: Installing Docker in Ubuntu 20.10 (Groovy Gorilla)

content: Analysis of the problem üîé So, analyzing the tutorial I found a problem on the 3rd point on through the SET UP THE REPOSITORY step. sudo add-apt-repository \ "deb [arch=amd64] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \ $(lsb_release -cs)\ stable"
title: Installing Docker in Ubuntu 20.10 (Groovy Gorilla)

content: Error ‚õî The error is in: ".. $(lsb_release -cs)\ stable" This expands to groovy stable, and at the time of writing and from my analysis, it is not supported by the stable docker community repositories.
title: Installing Docker in Ubuntu 20.10 (Groovy Gorilla)

content: The fix ‚úÖ So the workaround is simply to use a the test branch of the repository. ".. $(lsb_release -cs)\ test" Info I believe if you are using a non-LTS version of Ubuntu, you want fresher or nearer rolling-release software update, so using this repository shouldn‚Äôt be a issue. I‚Äôm not responsible for any faults, errors or breaks.
title: Installing Docker in Ubuntu 20.10 (Groovy Gorilla)

content: Automated Script üî® So I came up with a simple script to setup and automate everything for you. Warning This is fully automated, there is no end user confirmation whatsoever. #Install needed dependencies sudo apt install apt-transport-https \ ca-certificates \ curl \ software-properties-common \ -y #Download the docker repository gpg key and add it. curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo apt-key add - sudo add-apt-repository "deb [arch=amd64] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu groovy test" -y #Install everything related to docker sudo apt install docker-ce docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io -y Here is the latest version of the script on my GitHub.
